intro: Pleurospermum turkestanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface and produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical structure reflects evolutionary adaptations to its native habitat.
